name: Discriminatory practices; breastfeeding
text:
BREASTFEEDING IN PUBLIC ACCOMMODATIONS

 []    It is a discriminatory practice to deny, or attempt to deny, the full and equal enjoyment of the goods, services, facilities, privileges, advantages, and accommodations of a place of public accommodations to a woman because she is breastfeeding a child. [L 2000, c 227, pt of §2]
